channel.title: "Failed to save domain" when trying to create Whonix DisposableVMs.
channel.description:
Good day,
I've been trying to create Whonix Disposable VMs based on, https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Qubes/Disposable_VM#Creating_a_new_DisposableVM-Template_based_on_Whonix-Workstation but there is a problem I encounter with the very first step when typing
qvm-create-default-dvm whonix-ws
in the dom0 terminal. I get (skipped some lines):
Connecting to VM's GUI agent: .......connected Waiting for DVM whonix-ws-dvm ... /qubes-used-mem Disk detached successfully
DVM book complete, memory used=509576. Saving image...
error: Failed to save domain whonix-ws-dvm to /var/lib/qubes/appvms/whonix-ws-dvm/dvm-savefile error: internal error: Failed to save domain '11' with libxenlight
How can I fix this?
Thx,
--Jeff

item.title: "Failed to save domain" when trying to create Whonix DisposableVMs.
item.dc:creator: Torinizer
item.description:
Oh, you’re right! Sorry for not taking the time to read the rules!

Edit: https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues/issues/2482

Apparently this issue has not been fixed yet so I’ll have to wait for Qubes 4

Read full topic
item.source: "Failed to save domain" when trying to create Whonix DisposableVMs.

item.title: "Failed to save domain" when trying to create Whonix DisposableVMs.
item.dc:creator: Torinizer
item.description:
Good day,

I’ve been trying to create Whonix Disposable VMs based on, https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Qubes/Disposable_VM#Creating_a_new_DisposableVM-Template_based_on_Whonix-Workstation but there is a problem I encounter with the very first step when typing

qvm-create-default-dvm whonix-ws

in the dom0 terminal. I get (skipped some lines):

Connecting to VM’s GUI agent: …connected
Waiting for DVM whonix-ws-dvm …
/qubes-used-mem
Disk detached successfully

DVM book complete, memory used=509576. Saving image…

error: Failed to save domain whonix-ws-dvm to /var/lib/qubes/appvms/whonix-ws-dvm/dvm-savefile
error: internal error: Failed to save domain ‘11’ with libxenlight

How can I fix this?

Thx,

–Jeff

Read full topic
